content:
IProvideStarLayoutInfoBase Interface

Definition

Provides the data needed for the star layout.

In this Article

public interface IProvideStarLayoutInfoBase

Remarks

By default, the panels that lay out the ribbon use star sizing to show the largest possible control variation that can fit in the available space. Star sizing is a convention where the available space is divided evenly between the elements that need to occupy the space. The name derives from the fact that you specify star sizing by using an asterisk (*) in XAML.

Properties

TargetElement

Gets the UIElement object that this provider targets.

public System.Windows.UIElement TargetElement { get; }
Value
UIElement

The targeted element.

Methods

OnInitializeLayout()

Called before the star allocator is measured.

public void OnInitializeLayout ();
